body.p: Commissioned and built at Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania in 1861. The USS Lexington III was the third USS Lexington in the United States Navy. It was a sidewheel steamer. During the Civil War, the ship seized steamer W. B. Terry at Paducah, Kentucky, participated in the attack on Paducah, the Battle of Belmont, the Battle of Fort Henry, the Battle of Shiloh, the Battle of Saint Charles, and the Battle of Milliken's Bend. It also saw action in numerous encounters on the Ohio and Mississippi Rivers. The USS Lexington was decommissioned July 2, 1865 at Mound City, Illinois. There it was sold to Thomas Scott and Wooodburn on August 17, 1865.
